author: Staff Reporter
text:
Officials of the Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption (DVAC) on Wednesday arrested J. Ilamparuathi (28), a village administrative officer at Rakkiapalayam, and M. Rajesh (27), who allegedly acted as his agent, under the Prevention of Corruption Act.

DVAC Deputy Superintendent of Police N. Ravichandran told The Hindu that the VAO had demanded bribe of Rs. 3,000 from S. Velmurugan, of Sarangadu, for transferring the patta to his name for a plot. Velmurugan immediately lodged complaint with DVAC. Rajesh and the VAO were caught red-handed when Velmurugan gave the money to Rajesh, said the DVAC officials.

“Rajesh told us that he took the money on the behalf of VAO”, added the DVAC officials.
title: VAO arrested on graft charges
